meanings.definition: Simple eyes on an insect or other invertebrate.
meanings.sent1: The ocelli of the butterfly help it detect light and dark.
meanings.sent2: Insects like bees have ocelli that assist in navigation.
meanings.sent3: The ant thought its ocelli were tiny cameras spying on it.
meanings.sent4: The ocelli of the spider seemed to glow in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The scientist marveled at the intricate design of the ocelli on the beetle.

meanings.definition: A simple eye or eyespot in certain invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The ocelli on the snail are sensitive to changes in light.
meanings.sent2: The ocelli of the jellyfish help it sense its surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The ocelli of the worm looked like tiny jewels in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The ocelli of the shrimp shimmered like precious gems.
meanings.sent5: The ocelli of the fly sparkled in the morning dew.
